intro: Monadenium rugosum, commonly known as the rough monadenium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Monadenium rugosum is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in dry gardens.
